<python>
import pandas as pd

# List of African countries involved in the Belt and Road Initiative
countries = ['Algeria', 'Angola', 'Benin', 'Botswana', 'Burkina Faso', 'Burundi', 'Cabo Verde', 'Cameroon', 'Central African Republic', 'Chad', 'Comoros', 'Congo', 'Congo, The Democratic Republic of The', 'Côte D\'Ivoire', 'Djibouti', 'Egypt', 'Equatorial Guinea', 'Eritrea', 'Eswatini', 'Ethiopia', 'Gabon', 'Gambia', 'Ghana', 'Guinea', 'Guinea-Bissau', 'Kenya', 'Lesotho', 'Liberia', 'Libya', 'Madagascar', 'Malawi', 'Mali', 'Mauritania', 'Mauritius', 'Morocco', 'Mozambique', 'Namibia', 'Niger', 'Nigeria', 'Rwanda', 'Sao Tome And Principe', 'Seychelles', 'Sierra Leone', 'Somalia', 'South Africa', 'South Sudan', 'Sudan', 'Tanzania', 'Togo', 'Tunisia', 'Uganda', 'Zambia', 'Zimbabwe']

# Initialize an empty DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Country', 'Capital City', 'Surface Area (km²)', 'Population Density (people/km² of land area)', 'Total Population (thousands)', 'Merchandise Trade (% of GDP)'])

# Function to fetch data from World Bank API
def fetch_data(country):
    # Implement the API call and data extraction logic here
    # For now, we'll simulate the data retrieval
    surface_area = None
    population_density = None
    total_population = None
    merchandise_trade = None

    # Simulated data (replace with actual API call and data extraction)
    if country == 'Algeria':
        surface_area = 2381740
        population_density = 60
        total_population = 44790
        merchandise_trade = 45.4
    elif country == 'Angola':
        surface_area = 1246700
        population_density = 46
        total_population = 33200
        merchandise_trade = 46.9
    # ... (simulated data for all 54 countries)

    return surface_area, population_density, total_population, merchandise_trade

# Fetch data for each country
for country in countries:
    surface_area, population_density, total_population, merchandise_trade = fetch_data(country)
    df = df.append({
        'Country': country,
        'Capital City': None,  # To be filled manually or fetched separately
        'Surface Area (km²)': surface_area,
        'Population Density (people/km² of land area)': population_density,
        'Total Population (thousands)': total_population,
        'Merchandise Trade (% of GDP)': merchandise_trade
    }, ignore_index=True)

# Print the DataFrame as a Markdown table
print(df.to_markdown())
</python>
